Days of my youth!  too quickly fled,</br>Visions of love and bliss, adieu!</br>How ill acquired the aching head,</br>And manhood's sorrowing heart, for you!</br>Ah!  what avails, with hopeful eye,</br>The raptured Future to descry?</br>In kindness hid the dark unknown,</br>Be our's the pleasures past, since our's the Past alone.

Why lingers Recollection still,</br>O'er the fair scenes of lost delight;</br>What time, from yonder eastern hill,</br>Rose the mild sun of Being bright?</br>It is; though calmer reason turn</br>From wilds where Fancy's meteors burn,</br>She fondly gives the pensive tear</br>To joys by truth approved, and held by memory dear.

O come the forms by Feeling wrought,</br>And chace the soul's sad gloom away!</br>O come! — for years have only taught</br>How soon the seeds of bliss decay,</br>Lo!  by the tempest, sternly rude,</br>Life's blooming promise all subdued;</br>And manhood's yet unwithering prime</br>Shrinks at the wintry blast of unrelenting Time.

If high ingenuous Honour charm;</br>If Beauty win thy fond esteem;</br>Warmth, prompt at friendship's call to arm;</br>And Woman, all that lovers dream:</br>Thy mind from bitterest anguish free,</br>If days unclouded thou would'st see;</br>Then, close thine eyes on youth's gay lawn,</br>While yet the Eden bloom, while now the morning dawn.

Weak man!  what means the wish to gain,</br>With wearied steps, fame's arduous steep?</br>Why madly trust the faithless main,</br>To grasp Profusion's glittering heap?</br>Even all that conquest still adorns</br>Is often but a crown of thorns;</br>Still, the proud standard that he rears</br>Is hailed by orphan cries, and drenched with widowed tears.

Shall lettered Glory's generous toils,</br>A brighter recompence bestow?</br>Ah!  what are Learning's envied spoils,</br>But slight, and penury, and woe?</br>Deep to the winds poor Genius sighs,</br>And roves unseen, with tearful eyes;</br>Nor pitying friends his fate enquire,</br>Till, borne by misery down, unaided Words expire.

Since honours, riches, genius, fail</br>To soothe and satisfy the mind;</br>I turn to that Elysian vale</br>Of loves and graces, yet behind!</br>There, Fancy all her scene arrays;</br>There, Nature at the heart-strings plays;</br>There, sweetly wild, the varies year;</br>There, Joy's extatic thrill, and April's cloudless tear.

Days of my youth!  too quickly fled,</br>Visions of love and bliss, adieu!—</br>But ill exchanged the aching head,</br>And manhood's sorrowing heart, for you!</br>No more intent, with hopeful eye,</br>The rapturous Future to descry,</br>While kindly hid the dark unknown,</br>Mine be the pleasures past, for mine the Past alone!</br>
